summary: This bill, the Strategic Homeland Intelligence and Enforcement Legislation to Defend Against the CCP Act (SHIELD Against CCP Act), mandates the Department of Homeland Security to establish a working group to counter threats from the Chinese Communist Party (CCP). The Working Group will assess and report on CCP-related threats including terrorism, cybersecurity, border and port security, and transportation security. It also details information sharing, annual assessments, Comptroller General review, research and development, and a sunset clause. The bill explicitly protects constitutional rights and free speech.
